meanings.definition: The state of being naked or exposed.
meanings.sent1: The bareness of the tree in winter was striking.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the bareness of the model in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the awkward bareness of his wardrobe malfunction.
meanings.sent4: The bareness of the truth hit him like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The bareness of the landscape was both beautiful and eerie.

meanings.definition: The quality of lacking adornment or decoration.
meanings.sent1: She appreciated the simple bareness of the room's design.
meanings.sent2: The elegance of the dress lay in its bareness.
meanings.sent3: The bareness of the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The bareness of the walls emphasized the minimalistic style of the house.
meanings.sent5: The bareness of the stage allowed the actors to shine.

meanings.definition: The condition of being empty or devoid of something.
meanings.sent1: The bareness of the cupboard indicated it was time to go grocery shopping.
meanings.sent2: The bareness of the field suggested it had been harvested recently.
meanings.sent3: The bareness of the wallet reminded him to budget better.
meanings.sent4: The bareness of the classroom after school hours was eerie.
meanings.sent5: The bareness of her schedule allowed her to take up a new hobby.
